meanings.definition: To slide, typically sideways or obliquely, on slippery ground or as a result of stopping or turning too quickly.
meanings.sent1: The car was skidding on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: I saw a skateboarder skidding down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was skidding comically on the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her grades were skidding downhill fast.
meanings.sent5: The skidding sound of the car's tires echoed in the empty street.

meanings.definition: The action of sliding or slipping on a surface, typically while driving or on ice.
meanings.sent1: The skidding of the car startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: I heard the skidding of the sled on the frozen lake.
meanings.sent3: The skidding of the banana peel made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The skidding of time seemed to slow down in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The skidding of the hockey puck across the ice was mesmerizing to watch.
